ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Add smoothing spline modelling capability to nlme. Fit smoothing spline terms in Gaussian linear and nonlinear mixed-effects models
Add smoothing spline modelling capability to nlme. Fit smoothing spline terms in Gaussian linear and nonlinear mixed-effects models

name: r-lmesplines
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.1.20" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-lmesplines
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/lmeSplines_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/lmeSplines/lmeSplines_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: ac866696acd2df0c672aa982014a6d86a938b9284acc3501f7f0322ef186586c

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-nlme >=3.1_29
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-nlme >=3.1_29

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('lmeSplines')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('lmeSplines')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=lmeSplines
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: Add smoothing spline modelling capability to nlme. Fit smoothing spline terms in Gaussian linear and nonlinear mixed-effects models
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: lmeSplines
# Version: 1.1-10
# Title: Add smoothing spline modelling capability to nlme.
# Author: Rod Ball <rod.ball@scionresearch.com>
# Maintainer: Andrzej Galecki <agalecki@umich.edu>
# Description: Add smoothing spline modelling capability to nlme. Fit smoothing spline terms in Gaussian linear and nonlinear mixed-effects models
# Depends: nlme(>= 3.1-29)
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2013-08-04 02:08:38
# Repository/R-Forge/Project: nlmeu
# Repository/R-Forge/Revision: 122
# Repository/R-Forge/DateTimeStamp: 2013-08-02 14:37:01
# Packaged: 2013-08-02 18:20:41 UTC; rforge
# NeedsCompilation: no
